turns.query: best Italian restaurants in SoHo

results.name: Raoul's
results.summary: Known for its lively atmosphere and classic French-influenced dishes. The steak au poivre with its creamy, peppery sauce is a standout, and the bar scene is always buzzing.

personalization.forUser: Raoul's isn't strictly Italian, but the steak au poivre is legendary and the dimly lit atmosphere nails that intimate vibe you're after.

places.address: 180 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: We scored our second reservation here this year on a cold, snowy day when everyone was canceling. The inside is comfy and warm and tight but a great homie feel. We are set up with our same waitress. We had early this year, Aimee, who is hands-down with the best personalities and waitresses we‚Äôve had in New York. She remembered me because no one else ever orders the cocktail the Paper Plane. We went with the classics again and got the stick off of a burger up above with the artichoke vinaigrette. All hands down one of the best steaks, the best burgers any of us have had in a long time. Thanks Amy for the recommendation to head to Pete‚Äôs Tavern afterwards for the full Christmas bar feel.
reviews.author: Harris Lowe

reviews.text: I had an exceptional experience at Raoul‚Äôs. Truly beyond expectations. The food was outstanding; I ordered the steak, which was cooked to perfection and incredibly flavorful. The wine pairing complemented the meal beautifully, enhancing every bite. The service was warm, attentive, and made the entire evening feel special. Raoul‚Äôs consistently delivers a memorable dining experience, and this visit was no exception. Highly recommend!
reviews.author: Zhanna Arsirii

reviews.text:
My favorite thing about this place was the atmosphere. Really enjoyed the art and overall decoration. It was really hard to find a reservation but eventually booked for Sunday 9:45pm a month prior. Their specialty is the Steak au Poivre which was okay for what you pay. Really recommend the crab beignets as an appetizer
My favorite aspect of this place was the ambiance. I thoroughly enjoyed the art and overall decor. Although it was challenging to secure a reservation, I eventually managed to book a table for Sunday at 9:45 p.m. a month in advance. Their specialty dish, the Steak au Poivre, was satisfactory considering the price. However, I highly recommend the crab beignets as an appetizer. They serve 12 burgers a day, so if you want that, I recommend going as soon as they open.
reviews.author: zeynep dark

results.name: Il Buco
results.summary: A rustic-chic spot with a charming, dimly lit ambiance. They're known for their house-cured meats, extensive wine list, and wood-fired oven dishes, especially the roasted bone marrow.

personalization.forUser: The rustic Italian dishes at Il Buco are served in a cozy, wine-cellar-like setting, making it a great spot for a relaxed evening.

places.address: 47 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Came for the NYE price fixe dinner. Everything was amazing! The dishes were adventurous and executed beautifully. Was blown away by the attentive service as well. Will definitely be coming back.
reviews.author: Rebecca H

reviews.text:
Good food and nice service!
Food was delicious, but the cooking was unfortunately not even. Many of us eat a steak and some got well done when they ordered medium rare. I was lucky to get a perfectly cooked steak and it was fantastic. Otherwise I can really recommend this place.
reviews.author: Philip Modig

reviews.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner and look forward to going back next time we visit New York. Our server was excellent and informative, as was the bartender who was warm and welcoming and very helpful in selecting a sparkling wine. The ambience was perfect and romantic, the food was the best I can recall (and we dine out frequently). The flavors were just impeccable. We had the bikinis, veal chop and tagliatelle with black truffles. Salted caramel dessert was also lovely. A perfect evening.
reviews.author: A

results.name: Charlie Bird
results.summary: A modern Italian restaurant that's popular for its lively vibe and hip-hop soundtrack. The farro salad and the roasted chicken are frequently mentioned as favorites.

personalization.forUser: Charlie Bird has a lively atmosphere and a menu that focuses on seasonal ingredients, with dishes like the farro salad being a standout.

places.address: 5 King St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Fun lively restaurant with excellent food, highly recommend the beef tartare served with fried squash blossoms, the pork chop and the roast chicken! Normally don‚Äôt love large proteins the most, but they were amazing. The pastas (gnocchi and cavatelli) were ok, and the crudos were small but very nice. Would go back, love the fun r&b/hip hop soundtrack.
reviews.author: Maria Yu

reviews.text: Sorry to say but although I had high expectations from this place, it felt uneventful. And I mean that in a bad way. It looks and places itself higher than the actual delivery. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it was not a bad experience. But they aim to offer more
reviews.author: Alex Achim

reviews.text:
Charlie Bird is very much a presentation first establishment in my eyes. It's not bad by any means, but I am pretty disappointed especially since the food looks better than it actually tastes (not bad, just very average).

Razor clams: Tangy, slightly savory, but you should prob pass on it at $7/pp.

Burrata Crostini: it looks amazing, but there was no flavor. I literally only tasted the crostini.

Farro Salad: Nice composition of flavors, but it doesn't really stand out.

Tuscan Fried Chicken: Fairly flavorful and juicy, the best of the appetizers. But honestly, you are much better off going to a restaurant dedicated to fried chicken.

French Fries: Actually really good, crispy and salty. If I ever came back, I would always order these with my meal.

Chicken Milanese: ....the little side salad and the jam was the best part. The crust is the milanese is crispy and salted well, the chicken itself is cooked well..... But the chicken itself was not seasoned.

The portions were okay overall.

I'm not a picky eater by any means, but I was pretty disappointed overall with this meal. Maybe I was there the wrong day, but I left fairly disappointed. Although I rated it a 4 overall by NY standards, I would personally consider the food a 3/5 as I doubt I would ever return myself.
reviews.author: Khang Tran

results.name: Carbone
results.summary: An upscale, retro-style Italian-American restaurant with a theatrical flair. The spicy rigatoni vodka is a signature dish, and the tableside Caesar salad preparation is a classic.

personalization.forUser: Carbone is known for its old-school Italian-American cuisine and theatrical service, offering a unique and memorable dining experience.

places.address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text:
Carbone absolutely lives up to the hype. The spicy rigatoni is perfect‚Äîrich, decadent sauce with just the right kick. The chicken Massimo was surprisingly good: sweet, beautifully charred on the outside, tender on the inside, and finished with a deliciously creamy sauce. It came with shallots which were cooked perfectly!

The baked clams were excellent (loved that you can substitute bacon for breadcrumbs), and the Caesar salad was a generous portion made tableside with anchovies‚Äîclassic and delicious. The bread was good with a solid assortment and one that was cheesy and a bit oily. There was no fresh mozzarella available that day, but they made up for it with olive oil and pickled cauliflower.

Some folks say the place is cramped, but we were seated at a round table so we thought it was more than enough space for us to enjoy a nice meal.

Finished with a delicious raspberry sorbet, which was solid. Overall, a flawless meal and a true 10/10 experience. Would absolutely return.
reviews.author: Salem A

reviews.text:
We dined at Carbone many years ago, before all the hype, and at the time thought it was a solid experience with generous portions. This visit, however, I completely understand the buzz.

Despite being 20 minutes late to our reservation, we were graciously seated on a packed Saturday night ‚Äî a great first impression. The Caesar salad was phenomenal, with bold flavors and an unforgettable sauce. The beef tartare and spicy vodka rigatoni were definite standouts.

The ribeye was good but felt a bit heavy with the sauce. Dessert more than made up for it ‚Äî the carrot cake with ginger ice cream was excellent.

What truly sets Carbone apart is the ambiance. Cozy, intimate, and beautifully styled with real candles and timeless music, it feels like stepping into a glamorous 1960s supper club. Elegant, lively, and full of character ‚Äî a memorable dining experience from start to finish.
reviews.author: Yuliya Lubin

reviews.text: EPIC. INCREDIBLE. BEST MEAL IN NYC! I‚Äôve been wanting to come here for years! Bucket list experience ACHIEVED! I will be trying to find spicy vodka rigatoni that good for the rest of my life. Lemon cheesecake was the best I‚Äôve ever had as well. Start to finish, the meal was indulgent and the service was unparalleled!
reviews.author: Braquel Whetsell

results.name: Lilia
results.summary: Missy Robbins' acclaimed Williamsburg restaurant, worth the trip for its wood-fired seafood and handmade pastas. The mafaldini with pink peppercorns and parmesan is a must-try.

personalization.forUser: Lilia's wood-fired seafood and pasta dishes are worth the trip alone, especially the grilled clams and the mafaldini with pink peppercorns.

places.address: 567 Union Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA

reviews.text:
Super friendly staff and a great place to spend an evening catching up with friends. We booked a 6pm patio table, so we didn‚Äôt see much of the inside, but it was packed so reservations are a must.

The patio was perfect though, plenty of separation from the sidewalk and a comfortable setup. Most importantly, the food was fantastic. It‚Äôs not cheap, but the portions were fair and everything felt thoughtfully prepared with real attention to detail.

If I were to recommend two things, it would be the focaccia and the agnolotti, they were the table favorites.

Overall, we had a great experience and would absolutely recommend it.
reviews.author: Rohin Gupta

reviews.text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!
reviews.author: Vicki

reviews.text:
The service at this place is truly amazing! The food is good, but nothing special enough to make me want to return. For the scallops, you only get two small pieces for $30.
The pastas we tried received big recommendations, but they were lacking flavor.
The only thing I liked is the apple crostata. I wish it came with ice cream not the creme fraiche.
reviews.author: Anja A.

personalization.forUser: A Pasta Bar offers a casual, customizable pasta experience where you can choose your pasta shape and sauce, perfect for a quick and tasty meal.

places.address: 330 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: I love great Italian food and I especially love great pasta. Living in the West Village of Manhattan affords the opportunity to have some of the best pasta in the country - I Sodi, Via Carota, L‚ÄôArtusi, Barbuto ‚Ä¶ - the bar is very high. I ventured a little outside the neighborhood to try A Pasta Bar this evening and wow, I was not disappointed. The meal was outstanding. I was by myself, so I kept it simple - Panne Della Casa to start. Loved it - particularly the ricotta and olive oil dip. The focaccia was super fresh, salty, and flavorful. The pasta - the pasta was incredible. 10/10. I absolutely loved this dish. The Maltagliati with sausage and pumpkin. I love a great bolognese, which is on the menu, and this was similar but unique. The pasta was super fresh and the sauce was rich, meaty and flavorful   I finished with a hazelnut gelato and walked home with a spring in my step. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Aaron Kowalski

reviews.text: What an experience! I was so excited to experience watching the chef‚Äôs making your dishes right in front of you! I basically knew exactly what I wanted before I got there so I had very high expectations. As the Tonnarelli Cacio E Pepe satisfied my expectations! The salad was also delicious, had a tint of lemon as well. I loved the vibes inside as well. I would definitely got back! My heart is on the Casio e Pepe, so idk if I would try anything else!!
reviews.author: Roberts .J06

reviews.text: I went here for my 35th birthday with my wife and it was a dream come true! I had been looking forward to coming here ever since I discovered it. Wendy was our waitress and she took the time to go over my choices due to our dietary restrictions. We got the Pasta Tasting and enjoyed every bite! For our dessert, I was treated to their chocolate mousse with hazelnuts and homemade whipped cream which was absolutely delightful! I highly recommend coming here especially for your special occasion!
reviews.author: Taimur Bhutta

results.name: Piccola Cucina Estiatorio
results.summary: A lively Sicilian restaurant known for its fresh seafood and pasta dishes. The ambiance is casual and the portions are generous, with daily specials highlighting seasonal ingredients.

personalization.forUser: Piccola Cucina Estiatorio brings a taste of Sicily to SoHo, with fresh seafood and pasta dishes that capture the flavors of the Mediterranean.

places.address: 75 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text:
TLDR: Solid pasta spot, cozy ambiance.

Went to this spot with some friends - pastas were good, a bit indistinguishable flavor wise, but enjoyed them for the most part. It‚Äôs kinda funny that there‚Äôs a restaurant right next door that‚Äôs a part of the same chain. No free bread :(

Mains:
- Maccheroni alla Norma (eggplant tomato pasta, was pretty tasty)
- Cavatelli con rag√π di agnello e porcini (lamb rag√π, was generally pretty good, especially the mushrooms)
- Fusilloni di Gragnano con scampi, burrata, pomodorini e rucola (seafood tomato pasta, def the most flavorful)
reviews.author: Saaketh

reviews.text:
Amazing experience! Highly recommend ‚Äî the staff were so nice and welcoming. I got a wine recommendation and it was absolutely delicious. They even have gluten-free options!

It truly felt like being in Italy. The pasta was unique and flavorful, and the lobster pasta came in such a generous portion that the price felt more than reasonable. I can‚Äôt wait to come back!
reviews.author: Moon C

reviews.text:
I tried the lobster pasta and the beef ravioli here.
Both dishes were rich and flavorful, but the portions are on the smaller side.

The lobster pasta was the highlight‚Äîsavory, well seasoned, and easy to finish.
The beef ravioli, however, had a lot more cheese than expected. The first few bites were great, but the heavy cheese made it a bit overwhelming halfway through. If you don‚Äôt handle dairy well, just be prepared.

Service was friendly and the atmosphere was cozy.
Good spot if you like rich, strong flavors, but consider balancing your order with something lighter
reviews.author: Yuelin Li

results.name: Bar Pitti
results.summary: A classic, no-frills Italian spot that's a favorite among locals and celebrities. The menu is handwritten daily, and the pasta dishes, especially the penne alla vodka, are consistently good.

personalization.forUser: Bar Pitti is a classic spot known for its cash-only policy and simple, authentic Italian dishes like the pappardelle al ragu.

places.address: 268 6th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
Bar Pitti is a very charming Italian restaurant, really well located and with a lively atmosphere that makes it a great spot to enjoy a meal. The ambience is warm and welcoming, and you‚Äôre attended by Italian servers, which adds an authentic touch to the experience.

We started with bruschettas topped with prosciutto, which were excellent‚Äîsimple yet full of flavor. They also brought fresh bread with olive oil to the table, a nice classic touch. For the main dishes, we tried a few different pastas. The truffle fettuccini was good, but honestly, the truffle flavor wasn‚Äôt as strong or rich as we had hoped. The carbonara, on the other hand, was excellent‚Äîcreamy, flavorful, and definitely the highlight of the meal. The tagliatelle with marinara sauce was fine, though nothing particularly special.

One thing to note is that the restaurant does not accept credit cards, which is quite unusual and a bit inconvenient. On top of that, an automatic 18% gratuity is added to the bill, which I personally did not like, as I prefer to decide the tip myself based on the service.

Overall, Bar Pitti has great vibes, attentive service, and some solid dishes‚Äîespecially the carbonara. But the payment policy and the mandatory gratuity are definitely something to keep in mind before going.
reviews.author: Francisco Sim√≥n Verger

reviews.text:
Cafeteria vibes, average pasta, and an automatic tip ‚Äî overpriced for the experience.

I was excited to finally try Bar Pitti, but it didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. The space is extremely tight (even for NYC), and the whole experience felt more cafeteria/assembly-line than cozy Italian. Dishes came out fast but without much care. The pasta and mushrooms looked fine but tasted pretty flat.

For four people, our bill was about $270, the tip was automatically added without being clearly communicated. The receipt even suggests gratuity, so it‚Äôs easy to accidentally tip twice. Just something future guests should know.
reviews.author: Sara Bailey

reviews.text:
I waited ~40 minutes in line last night at Bar Pitti, which is first come, first serve. As we reached next to be seated, the bald owner/manager deliberately seated three separate groups behind us.

When I calmly and non-confrontationally said that we were ahead of those groups, he became confrontational, dismissive, and openly hostile. He then gaslit me, falsely claiming the people behind us had been waiting longer, which was objectively untrue and visible to everyone in line.

To make it worse, he attempted to seat yet another couple (who were also behind us) ahead of the group in front of us. That couple actually spoke up themselves because even they knew it was wrong. Instead of correcting the situation, the owner became aggressive with them as well, creating a scene in front of the entire line.

This was not confusion or a mistake. It was arbitrary, rude, and disrespectful behavior from someone who clearly abuses their position. Plenty of restaurants in NYC are busy. Very few treat customers with this level of contempt.

Food aside, the front-of-house experience is hostile and unprofessional, and I will not be returning. If you value fairness or basic respect, spend your time and money elsewhere.
reviews.author: Dev Wada

results.name: Freemans
results.summary: Freemans has that hidden-away vibe, tucked at the end of an alley. People go for the cozy, almost cabin-like feel and the hearty, American comfort food.

personalization.forUser: Okay, this place nails the candlelit, romantic vibe you're after. It's tucked away and feels like a secret, perfect for a quieter evening.

places.address: Freeman Alley, New York, NY 10002, USA

reviews.text: I wavered between a 4 and a 5 but decided on the higher rating due to overall experience. Absolutely beautiful restaurant. Down a graffiti filled alley, multiple rooms and two bars. Charming at the highest level. You felt like you were in a few hundred year old home. We ended up in an almost private room at the back of the restaurant because we were a larger group and it was perfect. We started with devils on horseback and artichoke dip.  Both excellent. The dip was not overly cheesy or greasy but had great flavor. The bread was nothing special but the dip was great. The devils on horseback were cooked well. Dark rich flavor. The bacon wasn‚Äôt greasy and it had a perfect amount of cheese.   We shared both the kale caesar and grain salad and would order both again. Both were not overly dressed and had great flavor. We added bacon to the caesar and it was a generous portion and crispy. The grain salad had a little tang to it and was very refreshing.  Also shared the Nashville hot chicken. Again generous portion. Chicken was cooked really well, very moist on the inside and crunchy and sticky on the outside. I don‚Äôt think it had much of a kick heat wise but was very tasty.   The waffle was a little disappointing. It was barely warm when served and didn‚Äôt have much flavor, definitely did not taste any cheddar. I didn‚Äôt taste the English breakfast or pancakes but both looked delicious and the people who ordered them enjoyed them. We also tried the ginger shots and they were great. The restaurant is definitely not cheap and we had a couple of things that were not perfect but overall the experience of the actual restaurant and the food is worth a visit or two or three. Will definitely return to try more food options .
reviews.author: Kathy D

reviews.text:
ABSOLUTE GEM

The interior is very pretty and welcoming. It can be over whelming to walk into a PACKED restaurant, but you‚Äôll have the best time!!

The Mac and Cheese - TO DIE FOR
Meatballs and Burrata - DELISH. The sauce is really good!!!
Salt and Vinegar Fingerling Potatoes - less vinegary than hoped, but still really crispy and salty!
Broccolini - TENDER, a little too much soy, but still very delightful

THE PORKCHOP - STUNNING. The apple slaw brought a rich, bright tang. The pickled red cabbage brought strong earthiness. The porkchop was smooth, tender, and full of flavor ‚Äî melts in your mouth.

DESSERT:
Sticky toffee pudding? Inject it INTO MY VEINS.

The ice cream ‚Äî seasonal and sourced locally. Solid, no complaints

The no flourless chocolate cake with cream was fine ‚Äî not sure i‚Äôd  get it again, however it pairs well with the ice cream (we opted for vanilla)

Service exceptional. No notes. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!!
reviews.author: Daniel Lee

reviews.text: Our waiter John H. created a pleasant atmosphere from the get go. ‚ÄúWelcome to the upstairs.‚Äù  His soft tone, attentive demeanor, and knowledge of the menus set the stage for a comfortable low key dining experience. The rustic decor, chill vibe, delicious cuisine, tasty drinks, and burst of color to the alley which leads to Freemans adds expression and an old time NYC feel. We will be back. Thank you Freemans and John H.  Especially for the unexpected birthday treat.
reviews.author: P ‚ÄúPredo‚Äù Redo
