results.summary: The classic bistro experience. Expect French onion soup, steak frites, and a lively, bustling atmosphere that regulars appreciate for its consistency.

personalization.forUser: Balthazar nails the candlelit, romantic vibe you're after, and while it's French and not Italian, the ambiance is classic and the steak frites are a must-try.

places.address: 80 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: A very pleasant experience. The snails were excellent, the onion soup was not bad, I had meat, the cooking and flavour were top notch, the fried potatoes were tasty and fresh, and the service was excellent. This is a place I would love to visit again and again. Nicase was wonderful, very helpful and made us feel very welcome. We are very grateful to her.
reviews.author: Serap Oyal

reviews.text: This restaurant has been on my wish list for quite a while now and since we were going to be in the city on Saturday, I met a reservation a month ahead of time. We had a reservation for 7:30 PM, but we were finished with everything we were doing and slowly worked our way down to Spring Street and arrived at 6:55 PM. We asked the ma√Ætre d‚Äô if we can possibly have a table and we were actually seated right away. Our server reminded us of the actress in Amelie, Audrey Tautou. She was very attentive & friendly. I started out with an old-fashioned and my partner had a glass of red wine, both were very good. We both shared the goat cheese and caramelized onion tart for an appetizer, and it was absolutely delicious. We are actually going to try to make this at home ourselves at some point. The crust was very light. My partner had a short ribs with polenta and I had beef bourguignon with mashed potatoes. He said the short ribs were the best he ever had. My meal was also very good. For dessert, we both shared the Paris Brest. It consisted of choux pastry with a hazelnut cream filling. My partner likes hazelnuts more than I do but I do have to admit it was very good. I also have to compliment the gentleman who kept filling my water glass, it never went empty. He was very attentive and friendly. Looking forward to coming back at some point, I heard the breakfast is very good there. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the people watching.
reviews.author: Richie A

reviews.text: Whenever we‚Äôre in the city, this is the place to go for breakfast or brunch. I haven‚Äôt been there for dinner yet but it‚Äôs a gem. Service impeccable, a bit noisy but that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs always packed so reservation recommended. Just love the croissants and my wife had the bouillabaisse which was delicious and the Norwegian Benedict. I had was absolutely delicious with the smoked salmon. We will be back!
reviews.author: Carl Haugen

results.name: The River Caf√©
results.summary: It's known for its romantic, candlelit atmosphere and Italian cuisine. Regulars appreciate the pasta dishes and the riverside views.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

places.address: 1 Water St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: Visiting this restaurant is an experience, not just a meal. Everything about it our visit here was fabulous. For us it was a splurge while visiting New York, to celebrate our Engagement, and The River Cafe kindly gave us a window table for this special occasion. The skyline looking back across New York from under the Brooklyn Bridge was truly spectacular. New York even decided to have it start snowing while we were there which meant we walked out into a winter wonderland. There was also someone playing the piano which added so beautifully to the ambiance. The food was flawless.  Everything we ordered was taste profile balanced and so yummy. There were complimentary little entrees before our chosen entrees arrived. The pace of food coming to the table was not rushed. The service was excellent. The only thing I can think of to enhance the meal/experience would be a palate cleanser. I would highly recommend a visit to the River Cafe.
reviews.author: Kirsty

reviews.text:
Dining at The River Caf√© is truly about the experience. We had the three-course meal, and the overall presentation was elegant. The environment was very cozy and romantic, with beautiful views under the Brooklyn Bridge, and the staff was nice, attentive, and amazing throughout.

While the courses were well presented, the desserts felt quite costly and didn‚Äôt fully meet expectations for a Michelin-level experience, as the flavors were a bit bland.

I‚Äôd recommend visiting in the summer if you want to fully enjoy the atmosphere and surroundings. Overall, it‚Äôs a memorable place mainly for the setting and service.
reviews.author: Manik Kumar

reviews.text:
An exceptional dining experience with a stunning waterfront setting. We celebrated our anniversary here and everything felt special ‚Äî impeccable service, outstanding food, and beautiful attention to detail, including a handwritten message on the dessert.ü•π‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

One small note: our reservation required an extra confirmation despite having already confirmed via WhatsApp. A quick call resolved it, and although we were initially seated away from the window, we were promptly moved when a window table became available. Overall, a memorable and elegant experience.
reviews.author: Lourdes Ruhstaller

results.name: One if by Land, Two if by Sea
results.summary: It's known for its romantic, candlelit ambiance in a historic carriage house. Expect classic French and American cuisine, like beef Wellington, and a piano player setting the mood.

personalization.forUser: This place screams romance with its candlelit tables and cozy atmosphere. The tasting menu is the way to go ‚Äî each course is a work of art.

places.address: 17 Barrow St, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
One If by Land, Two If by Sea was absolutely spectacular. Walking in felt like stepping into a storybook‚Äîthe soaring ceilings, glowing chandeliers, and beautiful holiday d√©cor created the most magical atmosphere.
The food was outstanding from start to finish. The escargot was perfectly prepared, the Beef Wellington was exceptional, the French onion consomm√© was rich and comforting, and the chocolate souffl√© was the perfect ending. Every dish felt special. They offer both a three-course prix fixe and a seven-course tasting menu, which makes the experience feel even more elevated. Yes, it‚Äôs expensive‚Äîbut absolutely worth it for a special occasion or a truly memorable night out. The pianist sat right in front of us and played so gently it felt like the music was floating in the background‚Äîelegant, intimate, and unforgettable. The service was impeccable, the cocktails were just as wonderful as the food, and the entire evening felt incredibly romantic. A truly unforgettable dining experience and easily one of the most romantic restaurants in New York.
reviews.author: Georgia Panagiotakos

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of taking my wife here for our anniversary, and the experience was exceptional from start to finish. From the moment I made the reservations, the staff graciously accommodated all my requests. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted at the door and assisted with our coats, setting the perfect tone. The atmosphere was enchanting, and the chef‚Äôs curated courses were nothing short of amazing, with outstanding food selections. The customer service (our waiter Albert was great) and hospitality were impeccable throughout. No complaints whatsoever‚Äîjust pure delight for the evening. If you‚Äôre planning on visiting there‚Äôs a parking lot right across the street
reviews.author: Jeffrey Hernandez

reviews.text:
SUPER OVERPRICED!
I overall like the restaurant! Dim lighting, piano, tables are so nice. Price is super high though! They force you to order 3 course meal which is 160$ for each person and at the end of the night we ended up paying 500 dollars for 2 people. I think it‚Äôs way too much for the food, service and experience we‚Äôve received. It‚Äôs super overpriced.And our waiter smelled stinky.. he definitely needed a shower..unfortunately.
reviews.author: Leman Ozdag

results.name: La Grenouille
results.summary: It's old-school French, known for its opulent floral arrangements. Expect classic dishes like souffl√©s and Dover sole, served in a formal setting.

personalization.forUser: This place oozes romance with its classic French cuisine and elegant, candlelit ambiance. It's definitely a splurge, but the kind of spot where memories are made.

places.address: 3 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA

reviews.text: Incomparable restaurant for a special ocassion/ date with your partner (but be prepared to spend a lot!). Le Granouille‚Äôs ambiance is incredibly elegant, romantic, and luxurious. The service was amazing but a little rushed (probably because we went in at 8:30 and closing was at 10- would recommend going earlier). There was live jazz which was amazing. There was only one option for food (one two or three step menu). The lamb chops and the lobster appetizer were my favorite, although the salmon and the beef tartar were also very good. The desserts were good although I wish we would have spent extra and gotten the souffle! 10/10 evening, though I probably wont be back soon because of the very high prices.
reviews.author: PM

reviews.text: Exceptional in every way! The decor makes you believe you‚Äôve been transported to Paris - so many gorgeous fresh flower arrangements, dim lighting, posh red cushy seating, pristine white linen table settings, exquisite French cuisine, impeccable service, and divine presentations - we enjoyed frog legs, oysters, Dover sole, cheese and chocolate souffl√©s.  Came back another evening for after theatre nightcap in their small elegant bar.  Two tables set up for elegant outside dining, too.
reviews.author: Christine Iger

reviews.text: Everything was excellent. The execution in the kitchen couldn't have been better. The food is traditional French and it doesn't try to innovate, it simply nails what it sets out to do. The foie gras terrine was the best I ever had. The ambiance is fancy, with large mirrors, candelabra, and flower bouquets. The service couldn't be more on top of the table. I wasn't aware jackets were required, and they provided one with a smile. The prix fixe is a good deal with plenty of food, and very filling. Definitely fit for a grand celebration, but I'd say it's expensive otherwise.
reviews.author: Javier Kohen

results.name: Blue Hill
results.summary: Dan Barber's tasting menu aims to showcase the possibilities of regional agriculture. Expect dishes that highlight unusual ingredients and preparations, often sourced directly from the restaurant's farm.

personalization.forUser: This is a splurge, but the tasting menu is an event ‚Äî think hyperlocal ingredients and candlelight creating a unique, romantic ambiance.

places.address: 75 Washington Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA

reviews.text: Honestly words can‚Äôt explain the experience, everything was perfect! The food, the service, and the atmosphere were top notch and well curated. The family style was extremely unique, with ingredients I‚Äôve never or rarely seen in other restaurants. Bonus points for a very interesting wine pairing throughout the meal. The atmosphere is very cozy and welcoming, honestly perfect for a special date, a business meeting, or catching up with friends and family.
reviews.author: Pirashan Ravi

reviews.text:
This has to be one of the best Michelin-starred meals I've ever had in NYC. I randomly went for lunch because I'm trying to visit every Michelin spot in the city, and honestly I don't know why it took me so long to finally get to Blue Hill.

The restaurant is tucked away in the cutest neighborhood, and the interior has a Scandinavian-meets-farmhouse vibe that feels clean, calm, and cozy. As soon as I sat down, it felt warm and homey in the best way. Lunch is $85 for a three-course menu, and I highly recommend it. There's no printed menu; they simply bring you what's in season, which I loved since I'm in my veggie era. Leave the thinking to them.

First Course:
We started with a plate of raw radishes, baby turnips, rye crisps, and an herbed cr√®me fra√Æche dip topped with dill. Simple but so fresh. The only thing I didn't love was the crackers, which had a bit of a cardboard-like mouthfeel. Then came a seasonal vegetable broth with squash, greens, and a dollop of cr√®me fra√Æche. It was genuinely one of the best soups I've had anywhere

Second Course:
The main course came with a perfectly balanced little gem salad, roasted carrots, the creamiest mashed potato pur√©e, slices of homemade whole-grain bread, and a flaky, crusty meat pie that was rich and comforting. Everything tasted super seasonal and thoughtful.

Dessert:
We finished with a warm apple crumble topped with a silky, tangy cream. The perfect ending.

Blue Hill completely exceeded my expectations. The food is incredibly clean, seasonal, and well-executed, and the space is beautiful. I'd absolutely come back, especially at such a reasonable price point.
reviews.author: Che J

reviews.text:
The place has a beautiful and cozy ambience and the service was great. The first course of our meal was fantastic and set high expectations - the cr√®me fraiche and buckwheat soil was so delicious I could eat that everyday.

Unfortunately the later courses were a bit of a let down for us. The leeks were too tough, the raw chicory was too bitter and not sufficiently complemented by the sauces, the turmeric ice cream was interesting at best.

The focus was on featuring the fresh produce and I think they did a good job at that.
reviews.author: Abhishek Sheshadri

turns.query: casual ramen spots near me

results.name: Tsujita LA Artisan Noodle
results.summary: Known for its tsukemen, where thick, chewy noodles are dipped in a rich, concentrated broth. Regulars appreciate the extra toppings like seasoned eggs and chashu pork that elevate the experience.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Alex

places.address: 2057 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA

reviews.text:
Came here specifically to try their world-famous tsukemen, and it did not disappoint.
This isn't just a meal; it's an experience.

The cold, perfectly firm noodles are meant for dipping into that incredibly rich and complex broth.
The flavor is deep, savory, and utterly addictive.
Following the recommended ritual, squeezing in the lime wedge for brightness and later diluting the broth with the provided soup stock transforms the dish and makes every bite interesting until the very last drop.

Be prepared for a line, as this place is a true destination on Sawtelle.
The service is efficient and focused on getting you to the good stuff quickly.
For anyone looking for an authentic, standout noodle experience in LA, Tsujita is an absolute must-visit.
reviews.author: Irwan McGregor

reviews.text: Really good ramen spot with lots of Naruto art and merch. They had their own IPA which I liked it was very smooth and paired with the ramen nicely. There wasn‚Äôt a long wait on a Saturday morning I would come back to try their dipping ramen. I got the spicy chashu ramen and it was delicious! The pork was thick and the egg perfectly cooked.
reviews.author: Kevin Madrigal

reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Ten stars if I could. Best noodle shop on Sawtelle.

For the last two years, Shoko and Josh have made Tsujita LA Artisan Noodles feel like a second home. They‚Äôve memorized my order, welcomed me like family, and consistently delivered the best noodles on the street.

I‚Äôve eaten here up to 3x a week sometimes, rotating between the tsukemen and ramen‚Äîand it never misses. The noodles are elite, the broth is dialed, and the consistency is unmatched. But what really sets this place apart is the service from their entire staff and especially Shoko, Josh and let‚Äôs not forget Suki and Mama San! Genuine, warm, and always on point - there is no place like it on Sawtelle.

If you‚Äôre on Sawtelle, eat here first. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!!!

üçúüëè
reviews.author: Carter Koch

results.name: Daikokuya Little Tokyo
results.summary: Expect a wait, but regulars swear by the Daikoku ramen: a rich, pork-based broth with perfectly cooked noodles, topped with a generous slab of chashu. The atmosphere is bustling and casual, perfect for a quick, satisfying meal.

personalization.forUser: Expect a wait, but their signature ramen is worth it. The rich, flavorful broth is what regulars rave about, and the atmosphere is lively and bustling, especially on weekends.

places.address: 327 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA

reviews.text:
Daikokuya Little Tokyo absolutely delivers. The curry udon with chicken was rich, deeply savory, and perfectly balanced‚Äîthick, chewy noodles in a comforting curry broth with tender chicken, onions, and carrots. The shrimp tempura on the side was light, crisp, and golden, not greasy at all, with a clean dipping sauce that let the shrimp shine.

You can feel the energy of the place the moment you walk in‚Äîbusy kitchen, fast-moving staff, and that unmistakable Little Tokyo buzz. Everything came out hot and fresh, and the portions were generous without being overwhelming.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic, satisfying Japanese comfort food in Little Tokyo, this spot lives up to the reputation. I‚Äôd come back in a heartbeat.
reviews.author: Daveed Tuck

reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been coming in and out of Little Tokyo in Downtown LA for about 25 years, and this place has always stood out as one of the most well-known ramen shops in the area. It‚Äôs consistently busy, often crowded, and parking around here has never been easy‚Äîwhich already tells you how popular it is.
I‚Äôve eaten here a few times over the years, and the most distinctive feature of their ramen is the broth. It‚Äôs extremely rich, thick, and hearty, with a very deep flavor. The soup is definitely on the bold side and can taste a bit salty, but if you enjoy a heavy, intense tonkotsu-style broth, this is likely right up your alley.
Personally, I wouldn‚Äôt say this is my absolute favorite ramen spot, but I also don‚Äôt assume my taste matches everyone else‚Äôs. Given how many people have loved and supported this place for so long, I think there‚Äôs a good reason it remains such a staple.
There are paid parking lots nearby, and street parking is also available. However, street parking can be difficult to find, so I‚Äôd recommend coming either earlier in the day or later in the evening to make parking a bit easier.
If you‚Äôre visiting Downtown LA or Little Tokyo, I think Daikokuya is one of those places worth trying at least once. Experiencing their signature rich broth firsthand can be both interesting and memorable.
reviews.author: Douglas Shin

reviews.text:
This is a long overdue review (was there on Aug 8, 2025) of Daikokuya in Little Tokyo (Los Angeles), but here I go.

My brother and I just attended a Dodgers game (great game and overall great World Series between the two same teams) and were hungry. We had spent nearly $60 within Dodgers stadium and had worked up an appetite after cheering on the LA Dodgers. If you all attended a baseball, you know it takes forever to get out of the parking lot which allowed me to find local restaurants that were still operating late into the evening which brought me to Daikokuya. The number of reviewers and the the stars assigned to this business peaked my interest so we decided to check this place out.

Waitlist - yes, this place does get very busy and expect to be on the waitlist. There is also outdoor seating for those that prefer to sit outside; you can indicate your choice upon signing into the waitlist. The staff is also cognitive of waiting time and insists that all members of your party are present in order to be seated, thus those who are smaller parties such as myself and my brother, we were seated fairly quickly (waited 20-25 minutes for a party of 2).

We were seated at the counter/bar area and ordered a few dishes to share- fried gyoza, chicken karaage, takoyaki, fried rice and a california roll. The food came out fairly quick and the staff service was excellent. There were a lot of other diners there late at night as well. All in all, the food hit the spot, don't expect your mind to be blown away like a Shohei Ohtani homerun.

Recommend: Yes

One small note: the water served there was pretty tasty. Not sure if we had too much beer or something that day, but we really noticed the taste of the amazing water there.
reviews.author: Mark La

results.name: Marugame Udon
results.summary: They specialize in udon and tempura, cafeteria-style. Get the Kama-age udon if you want a simple, classic experience, and load up on tempura shrimp.

personalization.forUser: Don't let the cafeteria-style line scare you off ‚Äì it moves fast, and watching them make the udon fresh is part of the fun. Grab a tempura or two to go with your noodles; they're surprisingly good.

places.address: 329 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA

reviews.text:
Came here with my friend at 3:30pm on a Wednesday; honestly the perfect time because it was empty and service was great. I‚Äôd come back to try the creamy options, but this visit was a bit of a mixed bag.

Beef with Fluffy Jidori Egg Udon (Double Portion) ‚Äî 3/5 I‚Äôm used to the beef udon at places like Marugame where you get that sweet marinated meat and plenty of broth. I expected the egg to just be an accompaniment (like a soft-boiled egg you add on top), but this was different. The "fluffy egg" was more of a scrambled-boiled style that mixed in and turned the broth into a thick, creamy sauce.

The Issue: It was barely a soup. The egg sucked up all the liquid, and there wasn't even enough "soup" for one person, let alone the double portion of noodles we ordered. I was honestly pretty upset because I really wanted a noodle soup. We had to pay $2 extra for a side of dashi just to fix the dish ourselves, which shouldn't really happen. Once we fixed the broth level, the flavor of the beef and egg was yummy, and the dish was great, but I‚Äôd probably just stick to the regular beef udon next time.

The Noodles: The udon is super thick and very chewy. I personally prefer my noodles to be a bit more flour-based, but if you like a heavy chew, you‚Äôll love these.

Mixed Tempura ‚Äî 5/5 No complaints here! The batter was so nice, light, and crispy. Totally delightful.

The Spot: Shared the double portion and tempura and it was the perfect amount for two people who aren't starving. Just be careful with the egg dishes if you actually want broth!
reviews.author: Kat C

reviews.text:
Marugame Monzo is a true gem in Little Tokyo, offering one of the most memorable udon experiences in Los Angeles. Their creative approach to this beloved Japanese comfort food elevates it far beyond the ordinary. The tempura arrives hot, golden, and perfectly crisp‚Äîeach bite showcasing expert technique. The fish roe shrimp udon stands out for its remarkable depth of flavor and the superb, chewy texture of the noodles that captures the essence of authentic Japanese craftsmanship.

Though the restaurant is small and often bustling, the wait is absolutely worth it. Every bowl here reflects care, precision, and genuine artistry‚Äîmaking Marugame Monzo one of the finest udon destinations I‚Äôve had the pleasure of visiting.
reviews.author: Jimmy Shen

reviews.text: The udon was good and the portion was generous, and the takoyaki was delicious. We came during rush hour, so we had to sit outside, and the restroom was always full, so we couldn‚Äôt use it. The prices are a bit high for the quality expected, and the staff could be a little more attentive. Still, it‚Äôs an option to consider if you‚Äôre near Little Tokyo.
reviews.author: Earvin Montero

results.name: Shin-Sen-Gumi Hakata Ramen
results.summary: This place nails the Hakata-style ramen experience. You can customize everything from the noodle firmness to the richness of the broth, plus they've got a good selection of small izakaya-style dishes to round out the meal ‚Äì regulars swear by the gyoza.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Alex

places.address: 132 S Central Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA

reviews.text: It was our first time going and we enjoyed the food. I loved my pork cutlet bowl so much, every bite was tender! The prices aren‚Äôt outrageously expensive lol, reasonable pricing! For two people it was about 35 (including drinks)
reviews.author: azure

reviews.text: Both the ramen and the katsu curry were decent nothing extraordinary, but tasty enough to enjoy. I sat on the terrace, which was convenient, though being in Little Tokyo it didn‚Äôt really feel like a cozy or stylish atmosphere. It was a bit noisy and more of a casual, quick stop vibe than a place to linger. The service was fine and the food came out fairly quickly. Overall, it‚Äôs a solid spot if you‚Äôre nearby and craving Japanese comfort food, but not the kind of restaurant I‚Äôd go out of my way to visit again.
reviews.author: M M

reviews.text: I first came here back in 2017, let me tell you; I‚Äôve moved many times since and tried various places for anything similar to this-and was always disappointed. The Hakata Ramen is something out of this world üî• . Anytime I‚Äôm in town I HAVE TO come here. Back then they used to sell Chashu Eggrolls and I LOVED them SO MUCH! I was so sad to order them and they didn‚Äôt understand what I meant (it was a while since they‚Äôve sold them and I hope they bring them back) . The video & Eggrolls photo is from 2017 vs the now (the bowl is black) . Back then it was pretty cheap, 8.50 for a Hakata Bowl and now it‚Äôs 13.75. If I have anything to complain about is that-they don‚Äôt sell the Chashu Eggrolls ! PLEASE!!! üôèüèΩ #ForeverCustomer
reviews.author: Eleane Ramirez

results.name: Orochon Ramen
results.summary: Orochon is known for its spicy ramen challenge, where you can try to conquer the Level 2 to Level 7 ramen. If you're not into the heat, their standard ramen options are also solid, with a rich broth and generous toppings.

personalization.forUser: Orochon is known for its spicy ramen challenge, but even if you're not trying to set records, the miso ramen is a solid choice. Be prepared for a wait, especially on weekend evenings, but it's worth it for a reliably good bowl.

places.address: 123 Astronaut Ellison S Onizuka St #303, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA

reviews.text: The noodle soup wasn‚Äôt very good. When it was time to pay, they held up their tablets but wouldn‚Äôt let me see the bill. Instead, they told me orally how much I needed to pay, without mentioning the service charge. However, they did explicitly remind me that I had to give a 15% tip. I did as they asked and then requested a receipt, only to find that it listed just two bowls of noodles. They had already charged a service fee and now were also asking for a tip, which I found unreasonable. I won‚Äôt visit there again in the future, and I must make everyone aware of this. They are not honest or transparent in the way they charge the service fee.
reviews.author: Guohua Tao

reviews.text: I had an amazing experience at Orochon Ramen. The restaurant is clean, cozy, and has a lively vibe. The ramen is delicious, with a broth that is rich, savory, and packed with flavor. The noodles are perfectly chewy, and the toppings are fresh and generous. Service was excellent; the staff were friendly, welcoming, and attentive. The portion sizes are very satisfying, making it worth the visit. Orochon Ramen is definitely one of my favorite ramen spots in LA, and I will be coming back again soon.
reviews.author: Rachel Talo

reviews.text: Got the miso ramen. broth was not rich, more of a watered down version. The pork they use is not chasu, which is clearly stated in the menu‚Ä¶just not great tasting though. Surprised by all the high star reviews which was what lured me in.
reviews.author: Laura D

results.name: Ramen Nagi
results.summary: Ramen Nagi lets you customize your ramen order from the broth richness to the noodle type. The signature Butao King is a pork broth, and they often have limited-time chef collaborations with unusual flavor combinations.

personalization.forUser: Be prepared for a wait, especially on weekends, but the customizable ramen bowls are worth it. Don't be afraid to experiment with the flavor profiles ‚Äì that's part of the fun.

places.address: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd Ste. #2850, Los Angeles, CA 90067, USA

reviews.text:
I visited Ramen Nagi and ordered the Original King (Tonkotsu) with mushroom, cabbage, egg, and chashu.

The ramen was fine, noodle texture was good but the taste was honestly just mediocre at best. It didn‚Äôt wow me, especially after seeing such a long line outside. I was probably expecting more.

The service was mixed. The host was friendly and welcoming, but the waiter seemed overwhelmed and made us feel rushed. I get that the space is tight and they‚Äôre busy, but I still want to enjoy my meal (especially when it was extremely hot) without feeling pushed out.

Overall, it wasn‚Äôt a bad experience, just not memorable. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd come back, it didn‚Äôt feel worth the wait.
reviews.author: Colton C

reviews.text:
First time I had this was actually in Hong Kong. They are called Butao Ramen before.
They rebranded to Ramen Nagi in other markets.

They serve legit tonkotsu ramen at a reasonable price.
$15 for the original tonkotsu and $17 for the squid ink one. Not bad at all.

One thing I don‚Äôt like is the long line. Good thing the lines settled down and the service was very fast now!

‚Äî

Friday night, there was a short line. I was alone and got a spot with just about 5 minutes of wait in line.

I tried the original one today. It was pretty legit and only $16.95. Quite reasonable.

I can‚Äôt stop eating the dashi sprouts üå±.

‚Äî
One tip - always order noodles as extra firm
reviews.author: Kendrick Khoe

reviews.text:
I‚Äôve eaten a lot of ramen in my life, and this was honestly one of the worst I‚Äôve ever had. I came in with very high expectations after reading the reviews, but after the first bite, I was shocked by how bad it was. I ordered the lamb ramen, karaage, and gyoza.

The karaage had a strange taste, and they added onions to the Japanese mayo, which made it taste off. The gyoza was okay, but there was barely any sauce.

Now, the ramen‚Ä¶ where do I even start? The broth had a very odd flavor that‚Äôs hard to describe and was extremely oily ‚Äî if you let it sit for a few seconds, a layer of oil would form on top. The meat had no seasoning and was completely bland.

Overall, it was not a good experience, and I highly doubt I‚Äôll be coming back.
reviews.author: faisal alsalem

results.name: Killer Noodle Tsujita
results.summary: They specialize in tantanmen, a spicy sesame ramen ‚Äì regulars often customize their spice level. The vibe is casual and quick, perfect for a lunch break.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Alex

places.address: 2030 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA

reviews.text: Good ramen place, but I‚Äôd suggest ordering normal menu items. The spicy dan dan noodles were rather sickening and filling rather quickly, leaving me unable to finish. The service is quite slow, but the place is great and spacious for hangouts compared to other restaurants in Sawtelle Japantown.
reviews.author: Jayden Kusuma

reviews.text:
July 2025 update

The Baseline: For a ramen restaurant the noodles must be fresh, cooked with consistency in firmness, broth must be tasty with good body, accompaniment additions must match with the style, and the plating must work for the ramen presentation/function.

Food: Still my top ramen place in Los Angeles.  My appetite gets killed at Killer Noodle!  Tokyo Style ramen with the thick rich broth and the noodles are so well made.  They just grab the sauce and makes it cling to them.  My friend had the White Mayo and tried my Tokyo and he will be headed for Japan in his food ordering in the future.  The White Mayo is still a great choice though.

Service: Good service when we came and we did not have to wait much for anything.

Ambiance: With the owners fixing up their Tsujita sister store I hope Killer Noodle gets her update too, but not at the cost of missing out on my Ramen.  Still it is clean and comfortable but there are some needs for updates in the restaurant.

Original Review:
The Baseline: For a ramen restaurant the noodles must be fresh, cooked with consistency in firmness, broth must be tasty with good body, accompaniment additions must match with the style, and the plating must work for the ramen presentation/function.

Food: Five stars for broth and noodles.  Four stars for the add ins and extra dishes.  Tokyo style beats Downtown style in my opinion because the body of the broth isn‚Äôt competing with extra vinegar.  The base bowl of ramen is about a respectable $18 so add one will kick up the cost.  Since measuring you numbness/spice levels is stirred into the base cost and the base ingredients is all you need the ramen is a five star dish.

Service: If it gets busy then wait staff are busy.  You will have to flag down your server so expect this in evening service.  Lunch will be more tame and enjoyable when it comes to service.  Water decanter chilled on the table lets me control my own water glass.

Atmosphere:  Killer Noodle is well decorated and has a consistent style.  The seats are comfortable and the tables are well situated with a good amount of eating area.  The outdoor patio has heating lamp so you will be okay outside in the winter.
reviews.author: The Baseline

reviews.text: Crowded on a Saturday evening. Good service. Downtown DanDan was average...a bit was too spicy for a standard level 3. The other dish that we ordered was similar, Downtown DanDan dry noodles, too spicy üî•ü•µ
reviews.author: Mao N

results.name: Tentenyu - Ramen
results.summary: Tentenyu specializes in Kyoto-style ramen, known for its rich chicken broth. Regulars often add a soft-boiled egg and extra chashu pork.

personalization.forUser: This place gets packed, but for good reason ‚Äì their ramen is consistently delicious. Try to go during off-peak hours to avoid the long wait, and definitely get an extra order of their signature fried chicken.

places.address: 2012 Sawtelle Blvd #6230, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA

reviews.text:
Tentenyu Ramen has the best tasting chicken broth. They serve both cold and hot Ramen soups.

The restaurant is kind of small but they do have indoor and outdoor seating.
reviews.author: Glenn A

reviews.text: Tentenyu Ramen, an import from Kyoto, specializes in Chicken Ramen with Tsukemen (larger dipping) noodles. Like many of the ramen places on the Sawtelle strip the actual restaurant is fairly small but has a great contemporary Japanese design with a nice patio area for those cool summer nights. I ordered the Chashu Tsukemen and was amazed at the amount of noodles they brought out! The broth was absolutely delicious and had a distinctly sweet teriyaki taste that wasn't overpowering. The service was very quick and our drinks were constantly refilled. Also, unlike other Ramen places, they do accept credit cards.
reviews.author: Chris LaLonde

reviews.text: Great ramen and broth! The cha siu was tender as well. Portion is decent, service was nice. Some of the topping should be free though. $1 for corn, $1 to make it spicy and $1 to make the soup rich (they put more pork fat), I think these options should be free. Other than that, everything's good!
reviews.author: Vincent Widiaman

turns.query: restaurants good for large groups in Brooklyn

results.name: Cecconi's Dumbo
results.summary: Cecconi's has a beautiful waterfront view and a reliably solid Italian menu. Their pizzas and pastas are crowd-pleasers, making it a safe bet for larger groups with varied tastes.

personalization.forUser: Cecconi's has a crowd-pleasing Italian menu that should work for Sam, while the waterfront views and lively atmosphere will make it a memorable experience for the whole group.

places.address: 55 Water St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: We celebrated our anniversary here and couldn‚Äôt have picked a better spot. The team was incredibly kind and attentive and they set us up with an amazing view of the Brooklyn Bridge that made the night feel even more special. The food was outstanding. The pastas were perfectly prepared, tasting truly authentic and homemade, and the salmon was cooked to perfection, moist and flavorful with no dryness at all. An unforgettable experience from start to finish.
reviews.author: Joshua Dyer

reviews.text:
I visited Cecconi‚Äôs with my friend and left feeling a little mixed. The space itself is undeniably beautiful, and the view of the Brooklyn Bridge is really something. It looks like the kind of place where the food should blow you away, but it didn‚Äôt quite match the vibe.

We ordered the Orechiette Arrabbiata, Eggplant Parmigiana, and two Tea Amo desserts. The pasta was alright, but the eggplant parm felt underwhelming, especially for the price. I also wish they had more vegetarian options on the menu. For such an impressive restaurant, the selection felt limited. The drinks were good I enjoyed that for sure.

Parking in the area is rough, so plan for extra time if you‚Äôre driving.

The highlight of the night was the service. Our host, Juan, was genuinely kind and attentive. When I mentioned I didn‚Äôt love the eggplant parm, he surprised us with cookies on the house, which I really appreciated.

Overall, amazing ambiance and great service, but the food didn‚Äôt fully deliver for me.
reviews.author: Anju Sehgal

reviews.text:
Went for an early birthday celebration to Cecconi‚Äôs in Dumbo and had a wonderful time. The food was good, service was great, and the views were beautiful. One thing to note is that it is located in the same building as the Time Out Market, so we were walking around looking for a separate building for a few minutes until we realized. We appreciated the fact that they were timely, our reservation was set for 7:15 pm and we were outside seated by 7:25 pm. We sat outside in the middle of October and it was not cold, they had heaters set up all around.
Our favorite dish was the truffle honey whipped ricotta, incredible! Order their free focaccia bread basket and it goes great with it. Food was good, not excellent but the ambience and the service made up for it. Wonderful date spot / somewhere to celebrate a special occasion! Recommending coming after sunset go get a beautiful view of the bridge.
reviews.author: Erica Matos

results.name: Roberta's Pizza
results.summary: Roberta's has big communal tables perfect for groups, and everyone loves their wood-fired pizzas. Order a few different pies like the Bee Sting with Calabrian chili and honey to share.

personalization.forUser: Pizza might not be everyone's first choice, but Roberta's has something for everyone with its creative toppings and lively atmosphere, perfect for a group looking for a fun and casual meal.

places.address: 261 Moore St, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA

reviews.text:
Buzzy/noisey atmosphere at the entrance, good host and reception with drinks at the bar before table was ready. Waiters not really alert, they messed up with my order, still smiley at least.
The pizza is very good/authentic Italian, average price 20 dollars each, but the service is very slow(and I mean it). Can‚Äôt say I loved the dessert as I left most of the pancake. Will still be definitely back as the it‚Äôs probably best pizza in Brooklyn.
reviews.author: Riccardo

reviews.text: A very local place, which creates an excellent atmosphere. Their pizza oven looks and smells incredible, but in the end, the result isn't anything amazing. I ordered a pasta dish with guanciale, which had more pepper than guanciale flavor, and the pizza, even though I ordered the "most popular" one, wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything special either, considering the incredible oven they have.
reviews.author: Brian Guti√©rrez

reviews.text: Kitchen cool Brooklyn vibe. Indoor and outside seating.  2 bars. The one we were at you could get food from, but every time you went back up for anything such as a drink or anything like that you had to stand on an enormously long line and wait quite a while, which wasn't great. The meatballs were very good, and the regular and Margherita pies were very tasty. Crust was soft, not crispy and thin.
reviews.author: Kevin Shapiro

results.name: Lilia
results.summary: Lilia is known for its wood-fired seafood and pasta dishes. The cacio e pepe is a standout, and the lively atmosphere makes it a good choice for a group.

personalization.forUser: Sam will be thrilled by the authentic Italian cuisine, while Jordan can appreciate the lively, communal atmosphere that makes it great for large groups. The pastas are the star here, so everyone will find something to love.

places.address: 567 Union Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA

reviews.text:
Super friendly staff and a great place to spend an evening catching up with friends. We booked a 6pm patio table, so we didn‚Äôt see much of the inside, but it was packed so reservations are a must.

The patio was perfect though, plenty of separation from the sidewalk and a comfortable setup. Most importantly, the food was fantastic. It‚Äôs not cheap, but the portions were fair and everything felt thoughtfully prepared with real attention to detail.

If I were to recommend two things, it would be the focaccia and the agnolotti, they were the table favorites.

Overall, we had a great experience and would absolutely recommend it.
reviews.author: Rohin Gupta

reviews.text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!
reviews.author: Vicki

reviews.text:
The service at this place is truly amazing! The food is good, but nothing special enough to make me want to return. For the scallops, you only get two small pieces for $30.
The pastas we tried received big recommendations, but they were lacking flavor.
The only thing I liked is the apple crostata. I wish it came with ice cream not the creme fraiche.
reviews.author: Anja A.

results.name: Buttermilk Channel
results.summary: Buttermilk Channel offers refined comfort food like their famed Buttermilk Fried Chicken, a favorite among regulars. The cozy, rustic ambiance makes it a solid choice for a group dinner.

personalization.forUser: Buttermilk Channel has a menu that is sure to please everyone in the group, with a variety of options ranging from seafood to hearty meat dishes. Plus, the cozy, rustic atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed group gathering.

places.address: 524 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA

reviews.text: Did brunch here on a busy Sunday. Was nice to see your place that is well run and able to serve a full house. Reservations look to be a really good idea on busy time is like Sunday brunch. The service was professional and friendly. Chicken sandwich tasted as good as it looked. Poached eggs were perfection. Pancakes were divine, the maple syrup was a sweet delight. And the fries, the fries! Don't forget to order some. Look forward to Dining there again when we visit family in Brooklyn.
reviews.author: Thomas C. Jackson

reviews.text: Stepping into Buttermilk Channel Restaurant felt like stumbling upon a breakfast paradise, and their Chicken & Waffles and Pancakes sealed the deal for an authentic morning feast. The Chicken & Waffles were a revelation, with the chicken boasting a perfect crunch and the waffles a comforting canvas for the flavors. As for the pancakes, they were a testament to homey goodness, fluffy and delicious. The care they put into sourcing quality ingredients was evident in every bite. The cozy vibe of the place, combined with the friendly staff, made it a genuine, comforting experience. Buttermilk Channel Restaurant is where breakfast dreams come true, a spot I'd gladly revisit for a taste of their hearty, real-deal dishes.
reviews.author: London alan

reviews.text: The place is very cute and the service is great. The walnut sticky bun was great, exactly what one would expect. The short rib hash had some interesting middle eastern spices, which gave it a unique flavor. The fried chicken sandwich is enormous, the chicken is so juicy and the coleslaw and pickles are nice to cut through the fattiness. The French toast was my favorite. It's very thick but soaked all the way through, the sauce is amazing, and the whipped cream is very good and just the right density/heaviness.
reviews.author: Yelena Conaway

results.name: Fornino
results.summary: Fornino is good for groups because they have long tables and a wide selection of pizzas. Regulars love the Margherita and the Prosciutto & Arugula.

personalization.forUser: With both Italian and pizza options, there's something on the menu for everyone. Plus, the lively atmosphere makes it a great spot for a group outing.

places.address: Brooklyn Bridge Park Pier 6, Bridge Park Dr, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: Wow is all I can say about this place! The view is only eclipsed by the food and service! Their open kitchen is spotless! The food and drink selection is the best of the best! If you are in Brooklyn Fornino Pier 6 is a must go, must eat, must repeat. And if you are looking for a workout they have beach volleyball right next to the outside dining option!!!! Just go and see it for yourself! You will thank me.
reviews.author: anthony prizzia

reviews.text: The atmosphere was amazing and the good was delicious. We visited on a beautiful day and sat outside. You can sit on the rooftop (beautiful view) or you can sit downstairs at the picnic tables. Either way, it was a great place to stop as we walked through Brooklyn Bridge Park. Highly recommend!
reviews.author: Maureen Mcgroarty

reviews.text: Pizza recipes are delicious, only thing is they came to us burnt. Views are incredible. Service was very friendly.
reviews.author: Kately

results.name: DeStefano's Steakhouse
results.summary: DeStefano's has that old-school New York vibe, with red leather booths and waiters who've seen it all. Expect perfectly cooked steaks, classic sides like creamed spinach, and a lively atmosphere that's great for a celebration.

personalization.forUser: Steak might not be the first thing that comes to mind, but the lively atmosphere and classic rock tunes could be a fun change of pace for both of you. Plus, everyone can agree on a perfectly cooked steak!

places.address: 593 Lorimer St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA

reviews.text:
I took my mom to this restaurant again for her birthday. The new location is not far from the old location and the decorations of the place are the same. Menu also the same or pretty close to last time my mom was here too. Steak is always great and I love bacon so much.

My family enjoy so much and I'm happy that I take her out to her favorite restaurant.
reviews.author: Melissa Naja

reviews.text:
We went to have steaks. They did not disappoint. The ribeye and filet mugnon were cooked to order, flavorful, and good size. The appetizers are tasty and good size for sharing. They have a large wine selection.
It can get loud even if its half full.
reviews.author: Yuliya Akchurina

reviews.text: Famous steakhouse nearby was cash only and ATM charges us 25%. So decided to challenge DeStefano‚Äôs found on google map. We liked it and highly recommended. Not sure when I will be around next time but definitely coming back here.
reviews.author: Shuhei Takeda

results.name: Dinosaur Bar-B-Que
results.summary: Dinosaur is a reliable spot for a large group, with a lively, blues-fueled atmosphere. You're going for the BBQ ribs and the pulled pork, and the sides are solid, if not the main event.

personalization.forUser: This spot's got that lively, communal vibe you're after for a group, and while it's not Thai or Ethiopian, everyone loves BBQ, right? Plus, the rock and blues bands they often have playing will keep Sam happy.

places.address: 604 Union St, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA

reviews.text:
Overall: Would recommend, would revisit. 8.5/10
1. The food are good, taste very strong and rich a lot better than virgil‚Äôs bbq, the briskets are must gets and sausage is very good too, the ribs is dry sometimes and tender the other  but it‚Äôs decent.
2. Hospitality is amazing, the server was extremely respectful and tried to help as much as they could.
3. Environment is clean, spacious and very comfortable to dine in.

-sawa
reviews.author: koresawa

reviews.text: Came here to eat dinner with some relatives, the food was delicious and the portions were huge! We all shared a meal with three sides and they were super filling. This was my 3rd time coming here and this place never disappoints! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a good BBQ spot. The staff here are very kind and attentive as well.
reviews.author: Ri D

reviews.text: Oldie but goodie, came in and sat at the bar it was happy hour and boy did it make us happy. The place wasn't too full. Josh the bartender did such an amazing job handling the bar and the tables in his area with attentiveness, grace and a smile. The ambience gives southern comfort. We only did an app on the happy hour menu the chicken bbq nachos delish and the Mac and cheese which was cheesy and gooey like I love. If you're in the park slop area by the Barclays  center stop in.üíõ‚ò∫Ô∏è
reviews.author: Tracey WM.

results.name: Colonie
results.summary: Colonie offers a rustic-chic vibe with a focus on seasonal American cuisine. Their family-style platters and communal tables make it a solid choice for a large group.

personalization.forUser: The exposed brick and rustic decor create a warm atmosphere that works for everyone, and the menu has enough variety to please both Jordan's adventurous palate and Sam's classic tastes.

places.address: 127 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: Top brunch in the city #1 brunch in Brooklyn for me! I absolutely LOVE their food, the hot biscuits out of the oven are to die for. They are the best I‚Äôve ever had!! And consistently so, been here 5+ times and they are perfection every time. The Turkish eggs are incredible, the flavors of yogurt, and how it‚Äôs brought together is a masterpiece. One of my favorite places to eat at.
reviews.author: Sholeh

reviews.text:
Excellent. I came here with intentions to sit at the chef‚Äôs counter, but it was too hot. Regardless, I could still see the chefs a little bit from my table. üôÇ

Let‚Äôs break it down:

1) The food is outstanding. We could‚Äôve easily ordered more, but didn‚Äôt want to ruin all the flavors in our mouth from the four dishes we had that were exquisite and the sense of being so well thought out and balanced, and enjoyable.

2) We ordered: celery salad, arctic char crudo, tagliatelle and the halibut. What I wanna come back for is the crispy, sweet potato appetizer, and the date cake dessert at a minimum. It‚Äôs hard to tell which one of the four dishes we liked the most. I would recommend everything that we had if I dropped one of them, it would be the celery salad, but that is purely personal preference don‚Äôt let it dissuade you.

3) Ambiance: super nice. Great atmosphere. We went on a Friday around 5:30 and it hadn‚Äôt filled up yet and that I think made it that much better depends on what you like.

4) Service and staff: everything came out in a timely manner, and our empty plates were also picked up in a timely manner. Our hostess was flexible and allowed us to explore where we wanted to sit, and our waitress was really good at offering recommendation based on the rest of the dishes we were ordering.

Highly recommend and I already can‚Äôt wait to come back.
reviews.author: Lia Arakelian

reviews.text: The moment I walked in I knew I would love this place. I started with a prickly pear margarita and the crostini with anchovies. Dinner was the haddock, which nearly melted in my mouth. Dessert was a small cake with fig sauce. The service was outstanding. A must try spot in Brooklyn
reviews.author: Susan Louis

turns.message: We want somewhere with good vegetarian options too

turns.query: restaurants good for large groups with vegetarian options in Brooklyn

results.name: al di l√† Trattoria
results.summary: This Park Slope spot is known for its Venetian-Italian dishes. They're good at accommodating large groups, and have enough vegetarian pasta options to keep everyone happy.

personalization.forUser: This neighborhood favorite has a menu that will satisfy everyone, from Sam's love for Italian to vegetarian options for Jordan. The pasta dishes are incredible, and the cozy atmosphere is perfect for a group.

places.address: 248 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA

reviews.text: We wanted to come to al di l√° for a while and glad we finally did. Made a reservation beforehand since this place does get busy on the weekend and glad we did. The drinks were delicious, we got a nice recommendation from a gentleman working here. The pasta was good - definitely fresh and quality ingredients but that‚Äôs it. There‚Äôs a lot of pasta shops in the area and they all sit at the same level of taste. Would definitely stop by again if I was ever in the mood for pasta and wanted to eat out.
reviews.author: Andrew Dabydeen

reviews.text: This Italian restaurant is one of the few places in NYC where you‚Äôll find rabbit on the menu‚Äîand it‚Äôs prepared exceptionally well. The pear cake was another highlight, perfectly balanced and memorable. The food remains consistently excellent, served in a warm, authentic setting. Also, returning after several years, we were thrilled to find the same high quality and familiar menu we remembered.
reviews.author: Olga NYC

reviews.text:
My colleague and I were in Brooklyn for a work trip and decided to try Al di L√† Trattoria, and what a gem it turned out to be! We opted to dine at their wine bar, conveniently located right around the corner on Carroll Street, and it was the perfect selection.

The atmosphere was welcoming, and the service was impeccable. Our bartender was the definition of professional, attentive. As for the food, the meal was absolutely delicious.

This is a must-visit spot in Carroll Gardens. We highly recommend it and will definitely be back next time we are in the area. A 5-star place for sure!
reviews.author: Chris Olsen

results.name: Stone Park Cafe
results.summary: Stone Park Cafe has a solid reputation for brunch and a relaxed atmosphere that works well for groups. Their menu includes enough vegetarian options to satisfy most, and the outdoor seating is a plus in good weather.

personalization.forUser: This spot has a lovely outdoor area, perfect for a large group, and the menu has plenty of vegetarian options alongside classic American fare to please everyone.

places.address: 324 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA

reviews.text:
Sunday brunching is one of my favorite places to be and Stone Park Cafe hit my radar. I was in the mood for some French Toast but noticed the Short Rib Hash on the menu, so I order that with a side order of French Toast. The bartender was quick and attentive for the most part. When the food arrived, everything was presentable and tasty. The hash could have had a bit more flavor but tasted very familiar but with a higher quality protein/meat. I had a Mimosa with my meal.

As I was sitting by the bar on a busy Sunday, as people moved around or departed the restaurant, I was left in a single seat between empty single seats. The host asked me quite politely if I could move over a seat to accommodate a couple that wanted to sit at the bar. I agreed, although I was mid bite into some of my food. I shifted over and the bartender moved my plate over to me. I felt uneasy and a bit overlooked in that moment as my experience was being affected to accommodate someone else. The couple graciously paid for my drink and expressed their understanding of their disruption of my experience. We had a great mini convo afterwards. I would like for staff to better address their guests to ensure their experience is protected. The bar seating is first-come/first-serve, and I think if I was reassured that my moving isn't obligatory, I wouldn't have felt the way I did. My experience was otherwise okay and the food was pretty good. I would definitely be back for brunch.

#itsfoodovereverything
reviews.author: Jamel Wooten

reviews.text: High quality and well worth it.  Even the bread gets shipped from a bakery.  Great selection of wine and none of the dishes.dissapoint.  The staff is friendly and welcoming
reviews.author: Makis

reviews.text:
Wow...
Talk about poor customer relationships and how NOT to encourage consideration for future visits.

Reading other reviews it is clear that I am not alone in my regret for considering having a meal here.

It is very simple.

Today is a gorgeous day.  I walk by.  I see one or two empty tables outside.

I realize that it is unlikely they will be able to offer a table for one.  But I ask the hostess "Can I get a table for one outside?"

Instead of start responding by explaining the situation in the context of friendliness and an apologetic perspective she leads by cackling in my face.

Cross one place off the list for my next dinner or small group gathering.  Or suggesting this venue to others.

I do not like negativity. See my other reviews.  But for a few minutes my day was ruined.
reviews.author: Bennett Joseph

results.name: Piquant
results.summary: Piquant serves up flavorful Indian cuisine with plenty of vegetarian options, making it a solid choice for large groups. People love the lively atmosphere and the reliable, well-spiced dishes.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

places.address: 259 Flatbush Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217, USA

reviews.text:
It seems we came on an off day for bottomless brunch, they were short staffed and the drinks were not too strong. Food took a while to come out and only seat complete party.

The fries were soggy, but the chicken was good. Overall very ok and seems to draw the crowd with tv screens and sports.(bowling sport). Staffs were very nice tho. Big space and has a downstair.
reviews.author: Amanda Wang

reviews.text: First time but not the last! We celebrated my mother's birthday weekend with brunch here and the food is absolutely amazing. Bottomless mimosas, excellent staff, and great music. You cannot go wrong.
reviews.author: Katera Holliday

reviews.text: Best brunch place everrrrr!!! Servers are friendly.  Food delicious.  You can do indoor or outdoor done in. The unlimited 90min mimosas are great and strong. Just wish they played some kind of music . Price is decent and gratuity is added on tje check. Overall I love this placeee. Never yet to disappoint me.
reviews.author: Marli P

results.name: Bar Bruno
results.summary: Bar Bruno is a solid choice for groups seeking a lively atmosphere and vegetarian options. They're known for their generous portions of classic Italian-American dishes and a boisterous, family-friendly vibe that regulars appreciate.

personalization.forUser: This spot has a relaxed atmosphere and is known for its generous portions, so it's great for a group. Plus, the menu features a variety of vegetarian options alongside their popular Mexican dishes, ensuring everyone finds something they'll enjoy.

places.address: 520 Henry St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA

reviews.text:
This cool little dive just blocks from the over-hyped restaurant down the street is awesome. Between the local beers and creative menu, with little to no wait times during the week, it was the perfect hidden gem for my wife and I.

We had a late lunch here after waiting to get on the waitlist for "that other place." The server didn't check on us much, but was super cool. Had to flag him down to place our order, all good (I hear it's like that in Europe, so maybe it's just a NYC thing).

OH MAN, try the Birria pizza, it's phenomenal (especially with the burnt cheese on the edges, so good)!  I definitely recommend Bar Bruno for a late lunch, casual drinks, or to try something new and creative.
reviews.author: Steve Wiideman

reviews.text:
Bar Bruno is one of those spots you almost don‚Äôt want to tell people about because it really feels like a hidden gem. The tacos are seriously some of the best I‚Äôve had in the city. They are super flavorful and fresh without being overdone. The vibe is laid-back and fun, with great old-school music playing in the background that makes you want to hang around a little longer.

Prices are also really reasonable for the quality, which is a huge plus in NYC. Overall, it‚Äôs just an easy, go-to spot if you‚Äôre craving good tacos without the pretense.
reviews.author: Justin Chung

reviews.text: The food is good but overpriced.  The add-ons quickly cause a burrito to cost more than $25.  There's an extra charge for everything.  However, the food is good so we keep coming back.  I'd recommend the burrito, ceaser salad and the (almost $20) queso. The seating outside is also nice.  It's a good neighborhood staple.
reviews.author: Elizabeth

results.name: La Vara
results.summary: La Vara offers a taste of Spanish tapas with Moorish influences, making it a solid choice for groups seeking diverse flavors. They're known for seafood dishes and have vegetarian options, so everyone should find something they like.

personalization.forUser: The tapas-style menu makes it easy for a large group to share a variety of dishes, and they have plenty of vegetarian options alongside the seafood. It's a great way for everyone to try something new, even if it's not their usual cuisine.

places.address: 268 Clinton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text:
Came here for the first time and was delighted by the good food.
We were two persons and had over 8 to 10 dishes including dessert and a few drinks.
The most outstanding dishes were the salchichon, arroz meloso and morros prensados, I was pretty impressed of their taste.
We had a vermut and wine to drink with the dishes.
Service was superb and the atmosphere great, even though the place was full.
The desserts were also very good.
Overall this is an excellent Spanish tapas plates with a twist and I will definitely comeback here again.
reviews.author: Gabriel

reviews.text: La Vara serves outstanding Spanish cuisine with remarkable attention to detail. The morros prensados and cochinillo were perfectly fatty and tender with rich, complex flavors. Their arroz meloso and rossejat delivered buttery grains perfectly seasoned with complementary spices. Everything we tried was delicious but we left slightly hungry despite sharing more than 10 dishes among our group of five, which was disappointing
reviews.author: Ryan Tammaro

reviews.text:
just ‚Ä¶ wow. our expectations were high after just having dined (and enjoyed!) next door at saint julivert recently. they were met and exceeded!

we were in on a thursday, on the later end for la vara so even though we were only two we were able to take a booth. started with delicious cocktails and ordered the anchovies, chicories salad with persimmon, blue cheese and the most interesting coffee-infused vinaigrette, and had the tosta tomaca which was so good we ordered a second! there was a special cogote‚Äîroasted kanpachi fish head with sofrito butter that was so tasty we cleaned it to the bone, and the cochinillo with tximitxurri was so succulent and flavorful and the crispy skin just takes it over the top.

dessert for us was basque cheesecake and a mini of the chocolate flan that we were gifted because we just couldn‚Äôt decide and there was a birthday involved‚Ä¶both had a bit of salt that did exactly what it was meant to and both were incredible.

Sari, our server was delightful and Rob the GM was the perfect host!

i‚Äôd love to visit with a bit of a group to be able to sample more of the menu in one sitting. either way, we‚Äôll be back ‚Ä¶ so many other dishes to try.
reviews.author: ebony shears

results.name: Colonia Verde
results.summary: Colonia Verde offers a robust menu with plenty of vegetarian options alongside its South American-inspired dishes. The restaurant's warm, rustic ambiance and communal tables make it well-suited for accommodating larger groups.

personalization.forUser: The outdoor garden is gorgeous for a group, and the menu has enough variety to please everyone. Even better, there are plenty of vegetarian options that are actually exciting, not just afterthoughts.

places.address: 219 Dekalb Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA

reviews.text: Very good place for Latin flavors in neighborhood. I really enjoyed the La Picosa drink: the cucumber & lime flavor really stood out (very refreshing and presentation was nice). The breakfast tacos tasted very healthy and all the duck dishes were well executed. Cute space in the backyard but only for rsvp folks ‚Äî we were walk-in so seated at bar (I recommend taking rsvp in advance). Service was good and overall good vibes.
reviews.author: Amandip Kaur

reviews.text:
Phenomenal atmosphere and food.  If you can, book the garden area in the back.  It will be easier to snag at the 6pm timing than the 7pm.  It will enhance your experience 2 fold.

Dishes to try:
- Trout Ceviche
- Fried Pork Belly
- Shrimp Tacos

About the only downside is that cocktails were a little strong, which is not relevant for everyone, and seen as a bonus to others.
reviews.author: James Mullin

reviews.text: Overall food is more hits but some misses. I really liked the mushroom taco and shrimp that came out sizzling in flavorful garlic butter. These were the most tasty dishes. I also loved their arepa and cheesy bread - the texture was amazing! Other dishes like the mac and cheese, duck taco, steak were so so.
reviews.author: Isabelle J

results.name: Roman's
results.summary: Roman's offers a reliably bustling atmosphere, especially appealing for larger groups seeking a lively vibe. Their pasta dishes often feature seasonal vegetables, providing solid vegetarian options alongside the meat-centric mains.

personalization.forUser: This spot nails both Italian for Sam and vegetarian options for Jordan, plus it's known for accommodating larger groups. The pasta dishes are the real draw, and there's usually something exciting on the specials menu.

places.address: 243 Dekalb Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA

reviews.text: Great food and service.  Not your normal Italian restaurant.  More like mommy's with a professional touch. Chairs could be softer.
reviews.author: Greg DeCicco

reviews.text:
It was such a treat to dine at Roman's in mid-October. I came on a rainy night, and the soft glow inside was inviting and warm. All of the food was delightful to the senses and DELICIOUS.

It would be hard to pick a favorite thing from the menu, since it was all so good (and since their menu updates all the time), but my table couldn't stop eating the Fava Bean Puree. All hail Chef Hannah and her team!

Not for nothing, it's also really nice to support an establishment that's committed to making the industry more sustainable for all who work in it.

Thank you so much for a wonderful special occasion dinner--I hope to return!
reviews.author: Andrea Daly

reviews.text:
The food was fine, but uneven. Some of the swordfish in the pasta was dry, some was good. The tomato salad was okay, it didn't do much with the tomato. The black bass was really good, tender and crispy outside, and the dressing really lifted the flavors.

I felt the waitress was rushing me. She stood by the table while I was taking the last portion of the salad, and she took the plates twice literally while I was eating. The place looked nice, but it was extremely loud. Even though loud is the sad trend in NYC now, the noise level here was off the charts and for that reason alone I can't recommend it, but adding the bad service, I really don't want to be back.
reviews.author: Javier Kohen

turns.query: best documentaries about music

results.name: Amy
results.summary: Details Amy Winehouse's rise to fame and her struggles with addiction, using home footage and interviews. It's a pretty straightforward but effective tragic arc, especially when it shows how the paparazzi hounded her.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

movies.overview: A pair of ex-lovers spend a spontaneous afternoon together that could either lead to rekindled love or further heartbreak.

results.name: Searching for Sugar Man
results.summary: A Swedish filmmaker sets out to discover what became of the mysterious musician Rodriguez, an early 70s Detroit folk artist who vanished after two albums. The film follows the clues from record contracts to South African bootlegs, where Rodriguez became more popular than Elvis.

personalization.forUser: This documentary unfolds like a detective story, revealing a musician's unexpected impact across continents. The soundtrack is killer, blending Rodriguez's folk sound with a global sense of mystery that Jordan will appreciate.

movies.overview: Two South Africans set out to discover what happened to their unlikely musical hero, the mysterious 1970s rock 'n' roller, Rodriguez.

results.name: Stop Making Sense
results.summary: Jonathan Demme films the Talking Heads at the peak of their powers, and it's just a straight concert film. David Byrne's performance of "Once in a Lifetime," with his jerky movements and oversized suit, is iconic.

personalization.forUser: Jonathan Demme captures peak Talking Heads energy in this concert film ‚Äî the band's art-school weirdness and David Byrne's boundless charisma are infectious.

movies.overview: A concert film documenting Talking Heads at the height of their popularity, on tour for their 1983 album "Speaking in Tongues." The band takes the stage one by one and is joined by a cadre of guest musicians for a career-spanning and cinematic performance that features creative choreography and visuals.

results.name: Buena Vista Social Club
results.summary: This film captures the rediscovery of forgotten Cuban musicians, culminating in their unexpected international success. Director Wim Wenders beautifully portrays their vibrant performances and the cultural significance of their music, particularly Ibrahim Ferrer's soulful vocals.

personalization.forUser: This is a total immersion into Cuban music history, and the performances are electric. The way director Wim Wenders captures the musicians' stories is just beautiful.

movies.overview: In this fascinating Oscar-nominated documentary, American guitarist Ry Cooder brings together a group of legendary Cuban folk musicians (some in their 90s) to record a Grammy-winning CD in their native city of Havana. The result is a spectacular compilation of concert footage from the group's gigs in Amsterdam and New York City's famed Carnegie Hall, with director Wim Wenders capturing not only the music -- but also the musicians' life stories.

results.name: The Last Waltz
results.summary: Scorsese captures The Band's farewell concert in 1976, featuring guest appearances from Eric Clapton, Bob Dylan, and Joni Mitchell. It's less a straightforward concert film and more a document of a specific moment in rock history, with interview segments offering insights into the band's dynamics and the toll of touring.

personalization.forUser: Scorsese captures the Band's farewell concert with such intimacy, you'll feel like you're backstage ‚Äî plus, the guest performances are legendary.

movies.overview: Martin Scorsese's documentary intertwines footage from The Band's incredible farewell tour with probing backstage interviews and featured performances by Eric Clapton, Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, Van Morrison, and other rock legends.

results.name: 20 Feet from Stardom
results.summary: A look at the careers of backup singers, focusing on their aspirations for solo careers and their experiences working with famous musicians. Features interviews with Darlene Love, Merry Clayton, and Lisa Fischer, highlighting their contributions to iconic songs.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

movies.overview: Backup singers live in a world that lies just beyond the spotlight. Their voices bring harmony to the biggest bands in popular music, but we've had no idea who these singers are or what lives they lead, until now.

results.name: Gimme Shelter
results.summary: It's a chronicle of the Rolling Stones' 1969 tour that culminates in the Altamont Free Concert, where the Hells Angels' security detail infamously turned violent. The film captures a palpable sense of dread as the concert spirals out of control, contrasting sharply with earlier, more carefree footage.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

movies.overview: A detailed chronicle of the famous 1969 tour of the United States by the British rock band The Rolling Stones, which culminated with the disastrous and tragic concert held on December 6 at the Altamont Speedway Free Festival, an event of historical significance, as it marked the end of an era: the generation of peace and love suddenly became the generation of disillusionment.

results.name: Wattstax
results.summary: Wattstax captures a benefit concert organized by Stax Records in 1972 at the Los Angeles Coliseum, featuring performances by Stax artists like Isaac Hayes and the Staple Singers. Interspersed with these performances are interviews and comedic monologues from Richard Pryor, offering social commentary on the Black experience in America at the time.

personalization.forUser: This concert film captures a pivotal moment in Black culture, and the raw energy of the performances is infectious. It's a time capsule of funk, soul, and social commentary that'll have you dancing in your seat.

movies.overview: A documentary film about the Afro-American Woodstock concert held in Los Angeles seven years after the Watts riots. Director Mel Stuart mixes footage from the concert with footage of the living conditions in the current-day Watts neighborhood.

turns.query: documentaries specifically about jazz musicians

results.name: Bird
results.summary: Clint Eastwood's biopic starring Forest Whitaker as Charlie Parker. It focuses on Parker's musical genius but also his struggles with addiction and self-destruction.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Jordan

movies.overview: Saxophone player Charlie ‚ÄòBird‚Äô Parker comes to New York in 1940 and is quickly noticed for his remarkable way of playing. He becomes a drug addict but his loving wife Chan tries to help him.

movies.overview: A documentary film about the life of pianist and jazz great Thelonious Monk. Features live performances by Monk and his band, and interviews with friends and family about the offbeat genius.

turns.query: best anime series to watch

An all out battle between the two greatest minds on earth begins and the winner will control the world.

results.name: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood
results.summary: Two brothers try to restore their bodies after a failed alchemy experiment. The world-building is detailed and the magic system is well-defined, with a satisfying conclusion.

To restore what was lost, the brothers seek the Philosopher‚Äôs Stone. Enemies and allies ‚Äì the corrupt military, the Homunculi, and foreign alchemists ‚Äì will alter the Elric brothers course, but their purpose will remain unchanged and their bond unbreakable.

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Matt

results.name: A Letter to Momo

personalization.forUser: Recommended for Matt

movies.overview: A shy 11-year-old's life takes a strange turn when she discovers three hungry goblins living in the attic of her new house. She misses her old life. She misses her father so very much. Until she makes some new ghoulish friends.

results.name: The Secret World of Arrietty
results.summary: This film has that signature Ghibli feel, focusing on a young Borrower girl and her interactions with a human boy. The animation is beautiful, particularly the detailed depiction of Arrietty's miniature world built within the walls of a house.

personalization.forUser: The lush, green world of Arrietty feels like classic Miyazaki, and the gentle story about connection is a total heart-warmer.

results.name: The Bitter Lesson
results.summary: Rich Sutton argues that AI progress comes from leveraging computation over human ingenuity. He points to AlphaGo's brute-force approach as an example of how researchers should prioritize scaling computation rather than hand-engineering solutions.

personalization.forUser: This piece challenges conventional AI wisdom and advocates for simplicity at scale, a perspective that might resonate given your interest in documentary-style explorations of complex topics.

articles.author: Rich Sutton
articles.summary:
The Bitter Lesson

# The Bitter Lesson

## Rich Sutton

### March 13, 2019 The biggest lesson that can be read from 70 years of AI research is that general methods that leverage computation are ultimately the most effective, and by a large margin. The ultimate reason for this is Moore's law, or rather its generalization of continued exponentially falling cost per unit of computation. Most AI research has been conducted as if the computation available to the agent were constant (in which case leveraging

results.name: Attention is All You Need
results.subheader: arxiv.org ¬∑ [Submitted on 12 Jun 2017 (this version), latest version 2 Aug 2023 (v7)] ¬∑ 1 min read
results.summary: This paper introduced the Transformer architecture, which replaced recurrent layers with attention mechanisms. It argues that attention alone is sufficient for sequence-to-sequence modeling, leading to faster training and improved performance, and became foundational for large language models.

personalization.forUser: This foundational paper kicked off the transformer revolution in AI, so it's essential reading to understand the field's current trajectory. Be warned, though: it's a dense technical paper, so set aside some time and maybe grab a coffee!
